entries: When a creature fails an attempt to free a creature swallowed by the cube by 5 or more, the cube can swallow it.

reaction.name: Wobbly Dispertion
entries: When the cube is hit with an attack by a creature not swallowed by it, it can make a Constitution saving throw with DC equal to the attack's damage, reducing the attack's damage to 1 on a success.

trait.name: Perfect Transparceny
entries: If the cube has not moved or taken an action in the last minute and has no creatures swallowed, it is invisible to creatures with a Passive Perception lower than 16.
A Medium or smaller creature that attempts to enter the cube's space is swallowed by it.

trait.name: Rolling Cube
entries: The cube moves only by rolling in 10 foot increments in cardinal directions, and can enter the space of any Medium or smaller creature.
A creature whose space the cube enters takes 4 (1d8) bludgeoning damage, then is pushed 10 feet away if possible, or knocked prone and restrained (escape DC 14) until the cube moves if it can't be.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The cube makes two attacks with its Spined Axopod, one of which it can replace with a use of its Split Valves.

action.name: Spined Axopod
entries: Melee Weapon Attack. +6 to hit, reach 10 ft., one creature. Hit: 13 (3d6 + 3) piercing damage.
This attack has advantage against a target with a Passive Perception lower than 16.

action.name: Split Valves
entries: The cube's armor splits as it attempts to absorb a creature restrained beneath it.
The creature must succeed on a DC 14 Strength saving throw or be swallowed (escape DC 14). On a successful saving throw, the creature can make an opportunity attack against the cube.
A creature swallowed by the cube takes 14 (4d6) acid damage at the beginning of each of the cube's turns.

reaction.name: Crushing Clunk
entries: When the cube takes 10 or more damage from an attack, it can move exactly 10 feet directly away from the attacker, if possible.

trait.name: Perfect Transparceny
entries: If the cube has not moved or taken an action in the last minute and has no creatures swallowed, it is invisible to creatures with a Passive Perception lower than 17.
A Large or smaller creature that attempts to enter the cube's space is swallowed by it.

trait.name: Gushing Collapse
entries: When the cube is reduced to 0 hit points, its membrane ruptures, spilling forth a torrent of cytoplasm.
Each creature within 15 feet of the cube takes 10 (3d6) acid damage and is pushed up to 20 feet away.

trait.name: Rippling Reserves
entries: If the cube has fewer than 107 hit points, it can take two bonus actions on each of its turns.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The cube makes two attacks with its Snaking Pseudopod, one of which it can replace with a use of its Waste Jet.

action.name: Snaking Pseudopod
entries: Melee Weapon Attack. +9 to hit, reach 30 ft., one creature. Hit: 17 (3d8 + 4) bludgeoning damage and the target is pulled up to 5 feet toward the cube.
Then, if the creature is Large or smaller and within 5 feet of the cube it must succeed on a DC 17 Strength saving throw or be swallowed (escape DC 17).
A creature swallowed by the cube takes 21 (6d6) acid damage at the beginning of each of the cube's turns.

action.name: Waste Jet
entries: A jet of indigestible detritus spurt from the cube in a 20 foot line that is 5 feet wide.

Each creature in the area must succeed on a DC 19 Strength saving throw or take 18 (4d8) bludgeoning plus 14 (4d6) acid damage and be pushed up to 20 feet away, or take half as much damage on a success.

action.name: Neurophage Intrusion (Recharge 5-6)
entries: Each creature Swallowed by the cube must succeed on a DC 19 Constitution saving throw or take 14 (4d6) acid damage and be infected with Jelly-Brains.

bonus.name: Cyst Armor
entries: The cube hardens its exterior membrane, gaining 20 temporary hit points. While the cube has any of these temporary hit points, it gains the following effects:

• Creatures not swallowed by the cube treat its AC as 21.
  • The cube cannot swallow creatures, move, or use reactions.
  • The escape DC for creatures swallowed by the cube increases to 21.

bonus.name: Cytoplasm Bulge
entries: The cube targets a 30 foot cone extending from itself, concentrating its mass on that side, and ends its turn.
At the beginning of its next turn, the cube can make a Snaking Pseudopod attack against each creature in the cone.

reaction.name: Vacoule Encasement
entries: When a creature fails an attempt to free a creature swallowed by the cube by 5 or more, the cube can swallow it.

reaction.name: Wobbly Dispertion
entries: When the cube is hit with an attack by a creature not swallowed by it, it can make a Constitution saving throw with DC equal to the attack's damage, reducing the attack's damage to 1 on a success.

trait.name: Amorphous
entries: The ooze can move through a space as narrow as 1 inch wide without squeezing.

trait.name: Shape Memory
entries: If the ooze takes any lightning damage, it is paralyzed until the beginning of its next turn.

action.name: Shifting Pseudopod
entries: Melee Weapon Attack. +3 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 8 (2d6 + 1) acid damage and the target suffers one effect of the ooze's choice:

items.name: Soften Armor
entries: One piece of nonmagical metal armor the target is wearing softens and sags, offering no AC bonus until the end of the ooze's next turn.

items.name: Soften Weapon
entries: One nonmagical metal weapon the target is wielding becomes springy and pliable, counting as an improvised weapon until the end of the ooze's next turn.

action.name: Chaos Meld
entries: One creature within 5 feet that is wearing or wielding an item affected by the ooze's Shifting Pseudopod must make a DC 11 Dexterity saving throw.
On a failed save, the item liquefies and the ooze absorbs it, gaining 5 temporary hit points. While it has any of these temporary hit points, the ooze's AC is increased to 16.

action.name: Cryptic Mimicry
entries: The ooze mimics the texture of nearby surfaces, becoming indistinguishable from them until it moves or is illuminated by a source of bright light within 10 feet of it.

trait.name: Amorphous
entries: The ooze can move through a space as narrow as 1 inch wide without squeezing.

trait.name: False Floor
entries: When a creature steps onto the ooze or fails an attempt to free a creature grappled by the ooze, the ooze can grapple it (escape DC 14).
A creature that fails an attempt to escape this grapple has disadvantage on its next attempt to escape.

trait.name: Shape Memory
entries: If the ooze takes any lightning damage, it is paralyzed until the beginning of its next turn and each creature swallowed by it is expelled into the nearest unoccupied space.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The ooze makes two attacks with its Shifting Pseudopod.

action.name: Shifting Pseudopod
entries: Melee Weapon Attack. +6 to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. Hit: 11 (2d6 + 4) acid damage plus 4 (1d8) bludgeoning damage and the target suffers one effect of the ooze's choice:

items.name: Soften Armor
entries: One piece of nonmagical metal armor the target is wearing softens and sags, offering no AC bonus until the end of the ooze's next turn.

items.name: Soften Weapon
entries: One nonmagical metal weapon the target is wielding becomes springy and pliable, counting as an improvised weapon until the end of the ooze's next turn.

action.name: Chaos Meld
entries: One creature within 10 feet that is wearing or wielding an item affected by the ooze's Shifting Pseudopod must make a DC 14 Dexterity saving throw.
On a failed save, the item liquefies and the ooze absorbs it, gaining 5 temporary hit points. While it has any of these temporary hit points, the ooze's AC is increased to 16.

action.name: Cryptic Mimicry
entries: The ooze mimics the texture of nearby surfaces, becoming indistinguishable from them until it moves or is illuminated by a source of bright light within 10 feet of it.

reaction.name: Inexorable Draw
entries: When a creature grappled by the ooze takes an action, the ooze can draw it deeper in, restraining it for as long as it remains grappled.
If the creature was already restrained, it is instead swallowed by the ooze and begins choking for as long as it remains grappled.

reaction.name: Vengeful Conduit
entries: When the ooze takes any lightning damage, before being paralyzed by its Shape Memory trait, it can deal an equal amount of lightning damage to each creature grappled by it.
